project_overview.tagline: Secure Computation Network for Blockchain-adapted Cryptography
project_overview.description: ARPA Network is a decentralized secure computation network built to improve the fairness, security, and privacy of blockchains. Originally founded in 2018 as ARPA Chain (privacy-preserving MPC network), it rebranded as ARPA Network and shifted focus to Threshold BLS Signature Schemes (TSS-BLS), a specialized subset of MPC. The network's threshold BLS signature infrastructure serves verifiable Random Number Generation (RNG), secure wallets, cross-chain bridges, and decentralized custody across multiple blockchains.

technology.description: ARPA Network implements an innovative threshold BLS signature scheme (TSS-BLS) adapted for blockchain applications. Originally focused on general-purpose MPC, ARPA transitioned to specialized threshold cryptography. The network enables secure computation and verifiable random number generation, serving as infrastructure for RNG, secure wallets, cross-chain bridges, and decentralized custody.
technology.privacy_mechanism: Threshold BLS Signatures (TSS-BLS), Secure Multi-Party Computation (MPC), Verifiable Random Functions
technology.blockchain_type: Multi-chain cryptographic service layer with EigenLayer AVS integration

eigenlayer_integration.ranking: Top 3 AVS by number of stakers

key_innovations.description: Distributed signature generation using Boneh-Lynn-Shacham algorithm enabling threshold security
Verifiable Random Function service providing unbiased randomness for blockchain applications, built on threshold BLS infrastructure
MPC protocol enabling distributed computation without revealing private inputs
key_innovations.note: Implied by threshold cryptography implementation, requires verification

description: ARPA Network is a secure computation network that provides a threshold BLS (Boneh-Lynn-Shacham) signature infrastructure for blockchain applications. It enables decentralized, verifiable, and blockchain-agnostic cryptographic services including random number generation, secure wallets, cross-chain bridges, and decentralized custody. As a privacy-preserving Layer 2 solution, ARPA uses secure multi-party computation to protect and validate transactions while increasing transaction processing times for practically any blockchain network. The network allows nodes to generate signatures asynchronously and in parallel, with a focus on security, flexibility, and multi-chain compatibility.
